channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: McDonald’s and Cava’s earnings have one thing in common: The K-shaped economy has a vice grip on the lunchtime crowd
item.description: The restaurant chains’ CEOs noted that while young, lower-income consumers are pulling back, high-income earners are still hungry to spend.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani’s signature housing policy is widely loathed by economists. Here’s why
item.description: Economists argue rent freezes benefit insiders at the expense of outsiders.

item.title: Bank of America prioritizes bigger AI initiatives, as annual spending on new tech increased by 44% over the past decade
item.description: Hari Gopalkrishnan, the chief technology and information officer for Bank of America, is responsible for the $4 billion spent this year on AI and othe...

item.title: Why So Many Leaders Say They Want Innovation But Reward Compliance
item.description: Many leaders talk about innovation but unintentionally reward safety. Real progress happens when curiosity, learning, and experimentation are genuinel...

item.title: Will Robotics Be Good In Your Workplace?
item.description: AI-enhanced humanoid robots like Digit advance toward real-world work, tackling focused tasks and reshaping enterprise roles.

item.title: Millennial CEO reveals ‘the most honest’ time-off request from his Gen Z employee: ‘I just had a breakup… I need a short break’
item.description: The boss approved the request without question, but concluded: “Gen Z doesn’t do filters!”

item.title: Supreme Court weighs Trump administration's tariff authority under emergency powers law
item.description: The Supreme Court will hear a major tariff case that could impact the $88 billion in revenue collected by the Trump administration under IEEPA, which ...

item.title: Private sector added better-than-expected 42,000 jobs in October, ADP says
item.description: The figure reported on Thursday is above economists’ estimates of an increase of 28,000 jobs and higher than the prior month’s revised reading of a lo...

item.title: Amazon vs Perplexity: Welcome To The Battle For The Future Of Commerce
item.description: Can your AI agents act as you, or do they need to identify themselves as non-human agents acting on your behalf? Amazon thinks they need a digital ID.

item.title: COVID-19 During Pregnancy Linked To Higher Rate Of Autism, Study Shows
item.description: Adverse developmental diagnoses in infants, including autism, were higher if the mother had COVID-19 during pregnancy, according to a recent study.

item.title: The Hidden Story Behind Tech’s Big Tax Writeoffs
item.description: Recent changes to corporate tax code regarding R&D spending from OBBB have caught some by surprise, but as Qualcomm and Meta are showing, the long-ter...

item.title: Inflation is so bad Americans are counting on Black Friday just to afford groceries and everyday essentials
item.description: "Black Friday is still a make-or-break moment for retailers, but shopper behavior is shifting," says Lightspeed Commerce founder and CEO Dax Dasilva.

item.title: Will you ever feel rich? This chart tells you whether you’re on track.

item.title: Why major financial firms are expanding Texas presence beyond traditional Wall Street hub

item.title: Fed president explains vote against interest rate cut
item.description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by 25-basis-points in October, though two policymakers dissented from the move, with one saying that he remains...

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
